concept.title: BMINSERT Command
concept.shortdesc: Opens the Select File to Insert Dialog Box.

conbody.p: Open the to select a dwg or rfa file to insert into the current drawing.
After selecting the file and choosing Open, the Properties panel is displayed, and you are prompted at the Command line.

section.title: Select insertion point
section.p: Specify a point in the current drawing where the entity will be inserted. You can change the insertion before it is inserted using the Properties panel and command line options.
Additional options: [Edit inserted entity/SMART insert/Rotate component/set Base point/Name/insertion Type/Flip/mUltiple/Change target 3d solids].

dlentry.dd: Enables you to change the parameter expressions for the inserted entity. Continue editing individual parameters until you press Enter to end the option. This option is also available in the Hot Key Assistant.

dlentry.dt: Enter the parameter name or press ENTER to finish
dlentry.dd: Specify the name of the parameter.
Specify the expression for the parameter.

Enables you to connect a Piping standard part to an existing Piping standard part. It automatically creates appropriate 3D constraints between the two parts and copies expressions for the parameters of the existing part to the new part. This option is also available in the Hot Key Assistant.

dlentry.dt: Select entity to insert to or
dlentry.dd: Hover the cursor over the Piping standard part you want to connect to.
Additional options: [switch Back/Rotate component/Flip/mUltiple/selection options (?)]
Enables you to change the rotation angle for the inserted entity.

dlentry.dt: Specify rotation angle of the insert
dlentry.dd: Specify the rotation angle.
Enables you to change the basepoint for the inserted entity.
Specify a new basepoint for the entity.
Enables you to change the instance name for the inserted entity.
Enter a name for the inserted entity.
Enables you to change the insertion type for the inserted entity.

Choose Local or External
Local: References an entity definition within the current drawing. See Block Reference.
External: References an entity definition outside the current drawing. See External Reference.
Enables you to flip the direction for the inserted entity.
Enables you to insert multiple copies of the same entity by specifying an insertion point for each instance or creating an Array.
Specify a point in the current drawing where the entity will be inserted. Continue inserting entities until you press Enter to end the command.
Additional options: [Edit inserted entity/Rotate/Base point/Name/Insertion Type/Flip/Array/Change target 3d solids]
Enables you to create an associative array of the inserted entity.

dlentry.dt: Specify base point for the array
dlentry.dd: Specify a point.
Specify the distance between columns
Additional options: [Direction]
Additional options: [Single row/Rectangular/Direction]

dlentry.dt: Select an end point for creating array
dlentry.dd: Specify a point.
Press Enter to accept the array.
Additional options: [Base point/Columns/Rows/Accept] <Accept>:
Enables you to apply the inserted entity to existing 3D solids in the current drawing.
Select the 3D solids to which you want
Additional options: [cleaR/Select all affected 3d solids]
All solids intersecting or touching solids in the BC_SUBTRACT and BC_UNITE layers of the inserted entity are affected.
Clears the selection set to ensure no solids are affected by the inserted entity.
